-e ---

𐌾 ɕ 'GJ' 'DJ' special consonant between dj,tj,ch,ƈ,zy,dg,gy,gj,j

𐌾𐌰𐌽 ⋍ -ян jən -jan
𐌾𐌰𐌽 ⋍ gehn ⋍ gone ⋍ going (≠genitive)
𐌾𐌰𐌽 ⋍ -дан ⋍ -den -ten -tun -done -do'ing verb suffix
𐌾𐌰𐌽 ⋍ -tion ma.TRUTH ճշմարտություն çəʃmɑɾtutʰjun c'est 𓌴𓐙𓂝𓏏𓏯𓏜 𓁦

The greek -ς was probably an abrevation akin to -𐌾 < -𐌾𐌰 -𐌾𐌰𐌽

𐌾𐌰𐌽 ⋍ -gan ≈ -ban 𐌾 peculiar correspondance probably carried by 𐌰 <V<PH 𜎽𜑐𜒔𜑐 hašpuš haᵘšᶥbuš 𐌷𐌰𐌿𐍃𐌾𐌰𐌽 /hoᵃʃen/ horchen hören hear

As with many 'sch' sounds it eventually dissolved into h/ø through centuries of corruption and simplification.

Z component:
𐌰𐍆𐍃𐌰𐍄𐌾𐌰𐌽 absatɕen absetzen ( set aside,put away,remove,dismiss,divorce )

G component:
𐌰𐌽𐌰𐌽𐌰𐌿𐌸𐌾𐌰𐌽 an'nøƌɕen …nötigen ( force, compell )
𐍃𐌽𐍉𐍂𐌾𐍉 σαργάνη SchnurGarn
-𐌾𐍉𐍃 -tian -genes!
𐍄𐌰𐌹𐌽𐌾𐍉 Zwinger
𐍃𐌽𐍉𐍂𐌾𐍉 which translates σαργάνη (sargánē)

T component special 𐍃𐌾⋍st
𐌺𐌰𐌿𐍃𐌾𐌰𐌽𐌳 kosten (test)
𐌱𐍉𐌺𐌰𐍂𐌾𐍉𐍃 Bucharians BuchGelehrte (𐌱𐍉𐌺𐌰𐍂 Bigga=good of Zoroastrian)
-𐌾𐍉𐍃 -tan -tian -genes!

ø dissolution:
𐌰𐌽𐌳𐌷𐌿𐌻𐌾𐌰𐌽 andḫulɕen enthüllen ( uncover, reveal )
𐌰𐌽𐌳𐍅𐌰𐌿𐍂𐌳𐌾𐌰𐌽 antwaurdɕen anti-vaurde.gen antworten ( answer )
𐌰𐍂𐌱𐌰𐌹𐌳𐌾𐌰𐌽 arbaιdɕen arbeiten (work,toil,strive,struggle)

𐍀𐍂𐌰𐌿𐍆𐌴𐍄𐌾𐌰 prophecy (-cy -𐌾𐌰 -zeihung) usually transcribed as Praufetja

-𐌾𐌰𐌽 -gehen -ziehen ⋍tuen
-𐌾𐌰𐌽 -tion suffix

𐌲𐌰𐌲𐌲𐌰𐌽 gengen gengen gehen, gängen √gang go
𐌲𐌰𐌲𐌲𐌾𐌰𐌽 gengɕen gengɕen gehen, gängen √gang-tion travel,journey
